body_html:
@drpngx

Thanks for your reply. Later I've found even running train_image_classifier.py from TF-Slim hangs so I feel it should be related to a particular hardware / system config issue.

I've been trying multiple ways to figure out the root cause in the past few weeks. I believe this is an issue unrelated to TensorFlow but is kind of specific to my motherboard. I'm using a similar motherboard as mentioned in Issue #1947 (ASUS X99-E WS 3.1).

Later, I've followed this web page: https://www.pugetsystems.com/labs/hpc/Install-Ubuntu-16-04-or-14-04-and-CUDA-8-and-7-5-for-NVIDIA-Pascal-GPU-825/ and installed Ubuntu 14.04 LTS with some additional steps of configurations I didn't do before:

  1. Setting "pcie_aspm=off" in the boot options. [This seems to be the fix.]
  2. Installed NVIDIA 375.39 driver and CUDA 8.0 separately instead of using the driver bundled with CUDA 8.0. [I don't feel this is the fix since CUDA 8.0 is also bundled with NVIDIA 375.39.]
  3. Fixed a symbolic link issue related to "libEGL.so.1" as described in this post.

I'm no longer seeing the issue right now. I still can't tell which of the aforementioned configuration steps actually fixed the issue. I'll test it more and update this thread so this might help some other people using similar hardware configs.

@drpngx

Thanks for your reply. Later I've found even running train_image_classifier.py from TF-Slim hangs so I feel it should be related to a particular hardware / system config issue.

I've been trying multiple ways to figure out the root cause in the past few weeks. I believe this is an issue unrelated to TensorFlow but is kind of specific to my motherboard. I'm using a similar motherboard as mentioned in Issue #1947 (ASUS X99-E WS 3.1).

Later, I've followed this web page: https://www.pugetsystems.com/labs/hpc/Install-Ubuntu-16-04-or-14-04-and-CUDA-8-and-7-5-for-NVIDIA-Pascal-GPU-825/ and installed Ubuntu 14.04 LTS with some additional steps of configurations I didn't do before:

1. **Setting "pcie_aspm=off" in the boot options.** [This seems to be the fix.]
2. ~~Installed NVIDIA 375.39 driver and CUDA 8.0 separately instead of using the driver bundled with CUDA 8.0.~~ [I don't feel this is the fix since CUDA 8.0 is also bundled with NVIDIA 375.39.]
3. Fixed a symbolic link issue related to "libEGL.so.1" as described in this post.

I'm no longer seeing the issue right now. I still can't tell which of the aforementioned configuration steps actually fixed the issue. I'll test it more and update this thread so this might help some other people using similar hardware configs.
